thread.title: Poore dominates in Thunder Car 100 at Anderson Speedway
thread.title_full: Poore dominates in Thunder Car 100 at Anderson Speedway

author: ken.delabastide@heraldbulletin.com(Ken de la Bastide)
title: Poore dominates in Thunder Car 100 at Anderson Speedway
text:
LOGO ANDERSON SPEEDWAY  28 pm Poore dominates in Thunder Car 100 at Anderson Speedway By Ken de la Bastide | The   Posted on Oct 17, 2015 by Ken de la Bastide 
ANDERSON — In a dominating performance, Josh Poore led 95 of the 100 laps to capture the Thunder Car feature on the Stoops Freightliner Night of Thrills Saturday at Anderson Speedway. 
Poore showed he had the car to beat by setting a new track record for the Thunder Car division during qualifications, turning a lap at 14.201 seconds which bettered the mark of 14.479 set in 2014 by Curtis Chapman. 
Poore led the first 25 laps and was chased by Trent Gossar the entire distance. Gossar took the lead on Lap 26 when Poore got trapped behind a slower car entering Turn 3. 
Poore returned to the lead following a restart on Lap 37 with an outside pass of Gossar. 
The 2015 Street Stock champion at Anderson Speedway was never able to shake a determined Gossar, who was lurking only a few car-lengths back of the leader. 
Jeremy Threet finished third, the last car on the lead lap. Johnny Magee came home fourth followed by Brian McKinney. 
“Travis Burge worked on this car all week,” Poore said in the AutoFarm McCrocklin Ford winner’s circle. “It only got finished on Thursday night. I knew Trent (Gossar) was fast. I know he’s a clean driver so I knew it would be a good race.” 
A strong run by Jeff Swinford came to an end on Lap 61 when it appeared he lost an engine in Turn 2 while running fourth. The incident collected the fifth-place car of Larry Southerland. 
Swinford started 16th in the field and worked his way up, cracking the top five on Lap 40. 
Marcum Welding Pro Compact champion Matt Tharp made it two feature wins in the last three races. 
Tharp worked his way up through the field and was running second on Lap 8 when he spun entering Turn 2. 
But that didn’t prevent him from the victory. 
On the restart, Nick Warner took the point from early race leader Gossar, but Gossar returned to the lead a lap later with an inside move on the back straight. 
Tharp used the same move to slip around Warner, and on Lap 16 he got inside of Gossar coming off the second corner and drove away to a comfortable win. 
Warner finished second with Kyle Allmond nipping Gossar at the finish line for third. 
“I could get used to this,” Tharp said in his return to the AutoFarm McCrocklin Ford winner’s circle. “During the season we were point racing, now we’re going for the wins.”
